notes.left: French Canadian trace their ancestry to French colonists who settled in Canada, English Canadians are of English ethnic origin and heritage, Aboriginal (First Nations, Metis, Inuit), White (European descent), Arab (e.g. Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Lebanon), Latin American (Hispanic), Black (African/Caribbean), East Asian (e.g. China, Japan, Korea, Taiwan), West Asian (e.g. Turkey, Iran, Afghanistan), Southeast Asian (e.g. Malaysia, Indonesia, Viet Nam), South Asian (e.g. India, Sri Lanka, Pakistan, Bangladesh), Filipino, Unknown, Other

Write the full term used in ICD-10 followed by the code in parenthesis, for instance: malignant neoplasm of the breast (C50). For WHO ICD-10 codes, refer to https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx
notes.right: Write code and full term used in ICD-10 separated by a (:). For WHO ICD-10 codes, refer to https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

notes.left: Write the full term used in MONDO followed by the code in parenthesis, for instance: breast cancer (0007254). For MONDO codes, refer to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo
notes.right: Write code and full term used in MONDO separated by a (:). For MONDO codes, refer to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo

description.left: Term and code used for the phenotype in the Human Phenotype Ontology terminology
description.right: Term used for the phenotype in the Human Phenotype Ontology terminology

notes.left: Write the full term used in HPO followed by the code in parenthesis, for instance: Hand polydactyly (HP:0001161). Refer to the Human Phenotype Ontology at https://hpo.jax.org/app/ for code identification.
notes.right: Refer to the Human Phenotype Ontology at https://hpo.jax.org/app/ for code identification.

phenotype_HPO_code.description: Human Phenotype Ontology terminology for observed phenotype

meta.notes: Refer to the Human Phenotype Ontology at https://hpo.jax.org/app/ for code identification.
